Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing place with great location”
Reviews.Author: Bruce f
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Beverly Hills Plaza last week. Staff was very friendly and helpful in anything that I needed. The hotel was clean and up to date. The pool was quite relaxing. I was 20 minute drive from the ocean and a 2 minute drive to Rodeo drive. The rates were very good for this hidden gem. My room came with a full size refrigerator, stove and microwave. I would defiantly stay here again. My wife had her hair done in the salon which was very convenient. The beds are top shelf.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BerkshireMash
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in early February to celebrate my husbands birthday and had a great time. We upgraded the room to a suite which was really nice and spacious with a small kitchenette. The bed was very comfy and big and the bathroom was modern and spotless. The suites seem to be in a wing to the side which my friend (who lives in LA) descibed as being "just like Melrose Place" which summed it up quite well! There is a side entrance straight out to Wilshire Boulevard from this wing so you dont have to traipse back through the main hotel every time. There is a hot tub (awesome), a koi pond (pretty) and lots of greenery so I really liked this wing. It felt like having your own apartment. The location was great. LA is not a walking city but you could walk to Century City or Rodeo if you wanted, it's maybe 20 minutes. We parked our car directly opposite the hotel most nights for free (one night it was busy so we parked just around the corner, again for free) and avoiding the $28 nightly valet fee at the hotel. Everything is easy driving from this hotel - Bev Hills, West Hollywood, Santa Monica, shopping etc. The staff were friendly and polite. We paid for one days worth of wi fi (about $15 I think) and had no problems. I would stay here again for sure - the rooms were super clean and big, the public areas of the hotel were well kept and cared for and the location was perfect. We didn't use the pool but it looked great. The hot tub we did use and it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Beverley Hills Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PerthDeb61
Reviews.Content: My Family of 4 stayed here in January it was our last stop after a four week stay in the cold climates of London Paris and New York, so not only were we a lot warmer but walking into our apartment was a joy, the kids who had their own apartment next to ours were ecstatic, these apartments our gorgeous and luxurious and soooo reasonably priced! I have recommended them to our friends already. The staff were nice and friendly and greeted us with a smile every day, the pool area is lovely and water is heated too, there is a small bar and restaurant but we The pool area is lovely and water is heated too, there is a small bar and restaurant that looks cosy, but we preferred the room service so we could enjoy the apartment, the menu is the same. There is also a day spa on the premises but it seemed quite expensive and a hairdresser. The hotel is on Wiltshire Boulevard which is very long, but away from the main centre near Rodeo Drive, we travelled by taxi, it was totally fine and convenient for us. There is bus stop out the front of the hotel as well if you don't like to travel by taxi, if you like walking there is a great shopping centre called Century City which takes about about 15 mins by foot. We dined at a fantastic restaurant called Rock Sugar at Century City, you will also find two department stores a grocery store and lots of designer and fashion stores. We will definitely stay here again if ever we get back to L.A! .

Reviews.Title: “Good value but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: ProfessAW
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business for 6 days. Checkin took forever as they were seemingly figuring out where to put me. The hotel has 2 sides - the upscale and the converted apartment building. I was put in the old side, and while it could be considered a "suite hotel", the actual size of the room is pretty standard. They are just narrow and long. The bellman showed me to my room (since there is no elevator on the old side), but did NOT take my bag, which I thought was odd. After climbing many stairs (only option), I settled in to find the only "desk" was taken by a desktop computer which cost $15/day. There wasnâ€™t even a coffee table, so if I wanted to do work, it had to be in my lap. The bathroom was also very small, with very little counter space, and the bathroom amenities are outdated. The mouthwash was nasty. The room had 2 flatscreen TVs (non-HD), but the cable was "being worked on" for a few hours so it was out. The kitchen consisted of a small sink and basic kitchen items. Cheap countertops and cabinets. After 3 nights of poor sleep from the sun shining in (no blackout shade and the shade did not cover the whole window) and the pounding from upstairs, I switched to a top floor room. Again no help with my luggage even though the stairs were the only option. Cable went out 2 more times. It seemed like they were covering up problems/mistakes, not fixing them. Another HUGE disappointment was the internet. For $15 for 24 hours, you get slow service on ONE device. I had 2 computers for work, so I had to pay $30 per day. And if I wanted to have my phone connect, it would have been another $15. Really? And you have to call the front desk to get a code to log in. Seems very outdated and cheap. Didnâ€™t even work properly all the time. Housekeeping was fine, the morning newspaper was nice, but no breakfast, and staff seemed burdened when I had a question/issue. In short, there are 2 sides to the hotel: nice and cheap. The lobby is nice, but the property is not well maintained. No desk to do work in the rooms. Card reader to get in the more convenient way did not work. Fitness center was about 20 years out of date. Staff was not so good. Walls/roof are very thin. Valet costs $28 per day when you can park across the street for free. Internet is $15/day for one device (no disconnecting/connecting to new device). Not really walking distance to anything special.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Get a Better Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: St.LouisEileen
Reviews.Content: Who doesn't want to say they're staying in Beverly Hills? But who can afford it, really? Well, try the Plaza. I just got back from my first visit, and I can't overemphasize how impressed I was. First of all, what it isn't. The Peninsula. Don't expect stars or ridiculously expensive furnishings or an air of pretension. Although, truth be told, there were independent film people there, and the lobby really is gorgeous. I has that old Beverly Hills look. What the hotel is: a comfortable, clean, efficient, warm, full-service hotel for about $100/night less than the surrounding places. I know. I checked. The room decor is not outstanding, but the beds are comfortable, and every room is a suite, which I think means big room with sitting area. I got upgraded, and had a separate living room that was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. There is a lovely pool area, a spa, hair salon and full exercise room. The hotel is perfectly sited, especially if you need to be on the west side, right at Wilshire and Beverly Glen, and about a block down from the lovely little Holmby Park where all the locals hang out. (I've stayed at Trip Advisor's #4 hotel, the Brentwood Inn many times, and as much as I loved it, I'd give it to the Beverly HIlls PLaza all over the Brentwood. It's more convenient, more roomy, has more amenities, and more helpful staff) And the best part of the Plaza? The staff. They went out of their way to help in everything big and small. They rented a Voltzwagen for me for $44/day, which was dropped off for me at the hotel and then picked up there when I was finished. I just gave my keys to the concierge. If you don't think that was worth every penny. It didn't matter what time of the day or night, somebody was available and happy to help(if you've been out all day and don't want to go out to eat, have them give you the info for First Szechuan Wok, which delivers. Really good basic Chinese). The hotel restaurant IS very small, and can easily get overcrowded at breakfast, but the food is basic and good, the bartenders happy to serve, and it's damn convenient. My only caveats would be that because the hotel seems to be made up of more than one building, its halls wander about, and it's easy to get lost.Not only that, if you have trouble with stairs, let the staff know right away so you don't get a room in the back, because stairs are involved. But that's really my only caution. I've already told them I'll be back this summer. I can't wait--especially because I can sit out by the pool then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: DetroitLouie
Reviews.Content: We stayed Dec. 30-31, 2011 in two rooms, one containing my wife and myself, the other our daughter, her husband and their two year old son. We took two adjoining executive rooms (bedroom and front room with kitchen essentials). It was perfect. First, we booked the rooms only days before and were trying to save by booking one exec room and one standard. When we got to the reception desk the hotel upgraded us (about $10/night) to two executive rooms so that we could be next to each other. That was extremely helpful and considerate of them. The staff was always very nice and accommodating, from the reception to the valet staff. The location is great, on Wilshire Blvd between Westwood and Beverly HIlls. We even found parking on the street both days and were able to avoid the $28/night parking fee. That may have been because of the holiday season, though, and if you did have to use their parking, it is valet and convenient. In the back, near our rooms, there is some rushing water and a pond with koi. Our 2 year old grandson loved it. The building looks like it was two older motels put together, refurbished, and a new front added. It is owned by Donald Sterling, so my guess is that when the real estate heats up again he would sell or convert this considerable footprint to a high rise condo building, like the many others on that stretch of Wilshire. But while it is there it is a little gem, well run at very reasonable price in a great location for those who want to get to central and west L.A. We were all extremely happy with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pandoras_chocolates
Reviews.Content: Coming off the back-end of two very long flights, we decided to break up our journey in Beverly Hills (for a variety of reasons, including the ever-popular "let's walk up and down Rodeo Drive experience"). A friend recommended the Plaza. It was a great choice. It's a unique hotel, situated around a courtyard with swimming pool. We asked for a quiet room away from Wilshire Blvd (which is a tad busy), and they put us in what was effectively a second wing. We had to walk past a little waterfall, the jacuzzi, loads of gorgeous green plants, and up some winding stairs until we reached our huge, well appointed room. We were away from all street noise and slept in peace and quiet. As I said, our room was huge: bedroom, kitchen/dining/living room, lots of storage space, and some comfy sofas. It was not newly decorated, but everything was extremely clean and worked. We walked to the centre of Beverly Hills (around 20 minutes or so) for dinner and a bit of sightseeing. There's nothing much around the hotel, so you'll either have a bit of a walk or you'll need to drive. Traffic can be terrible on Wilshire -- we drove up from LAX in rush hour, and thanks to construction it took quite a while. Just be patient and be prepared for arbitrary stupidity from other drivers, and you'll be fine. The staff at the hotel were great, from initial greetings from the parking valet, to the check-in staff, to housekeeping. Everyone was friendly and went out of their way to help. Finally, LA is expensive, but the Plaza is very reasonably priced, and you get a lot for your money. We'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff & poor location”
Reviews.Author: Pengu_2008
Reviews.Content: The staff are good at doing nothing... I think maybe daddy owns the hotel? The was one bell man who was helpful! When we arrive we turned up in a taxi as our flight had been delayed and a second town car wasn't organised... this meant we weren't acknowledged and i had to ask two people to help with our bags. The room was tiny for $230 per night. I highly recommend "The London West" this hotel is awesome compared.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: JaneC26
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its great location and the fact that it had suites and kitchens. There is also a pool and a gym. In fact, we had a lovely apartment, on the pool side, with a double bedroom and a rollaway bed for my son (Mum & two teenagers). The staff were very helpful; the restaurant, which we tried once, was adequate (but the new Westfield Century shopping centre is a lovely walk away, with great restaurants and supermarket). Our favourite thing was probably the real hummingbird we saw buzzing about in the flowers beside the pool. We did find out on our second day, whilst on a bus tour, that the actor Freddie Prinze died in the building before it became a hotel - but that was thirty-four years ago!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Old School Hotel But With Reservations (Pardon the Pun)”
Reviews.Author: cjennt
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this hotel in May of 2010 after hearing that this was the place that the late actor Freddie Prinze ( was a big fan of "Chico and the Man") spent his last day/nights here. Yes, for this was the place where Freddie Prinze committed suicide in January of 1977. Well, even weirder, upon checking into this establishment a second time recently in August of 2011, we got room #217 which is a huuuuuge (nearly 1500 sq. ft room) right next to the room #216 where Freddie spent his last days (or nights). I have to say that while this hotel which was a former apt. building back in the 1970s era, is kind of old school glamour and has very nice front desk staff, it may not be for every one. However, being that I am intrigued by true crime and the old Hollywood crowd, I just had to stay here yet another time. Our room was on the big suite side which features the one and two bedroom suites which range from 1200-2000 sq. ft. The smaller studio style rooms are on the other side of the hotel by the very beautiful hillside waterfall and koi fish pond. While we absolutely loved the room which also features a kitchenette and gorgeous living area, dining room and beautiful one-bedroom, we found the hotel to be rather noisy at night. Most of the rooms in the larger section (floors 1-3) face the pool and cabanas, we ran into a different if not unusual problem. Be it because our room was adjacent to the infamous Freddie Prinze room or whether other factors were at play, during our three night stay, every single night (like clockwork) at 2:33 AM, yes in the unGodly hours of the morning, our neighbors who were at the very end of the hallway, would let their children (under 10 years of age) run amok and scream at this hour. My friends and I very peacefully hung out in the lounge area of our deck in front of room #217 and the kids from these seemingly Middle Eastern (nothing against them) neighbors let their kids run shrieking past our windows. On three consecutive nights, I was awakened by them at that same time, and went down to the front desk to complain. I was amazed that 1). people would let their small children run around the hotel screaming at that hour and that 2). the parents didn't seem to care. The response from the front desk was "we'll take care of it" and though they were very diplomatic, despite my rather forceful language, they didn't seem to take active measures to stop the disturbance which other guests noticed and complained about audibly upon hearing these obnoxious and unruly kids. It is amazing to me that, in an establishment that is ostensibly an upscale one ( no, it's not the Hotel Bel-Air nor the Beverly Hills), the management cannot control the outlandish behavior of their guests. Overall, we LOVED the room and the staff was superficially nice, this party hotel seems to not want to get involved with quelling their unruly guests and from what we noticed, has had quite a few unfortunate happenings with various patrons that have come to stay there. I am not saying that this is not a good place, but something very odd is happening at this hotel and I say enter at your own risk if you are sensitive to noise. Granted, this may have been an isolated incident what with the people that caused my party this grief, but if you want a good value for the BH area and don't mind possible noise, I think that this is a good place for what it is and is very convenient if you want to explore the Beverly Hills area. STill, I AM PUZZLED AS to why the management allows loud parties and children to disturb the other neighbors at wee hours of the AM. Yeah, I'd probably go back, but I would bring the ear plugs and hope that I wouldn't be awakened by screaming kids at 2:33 AM, LOL.

Reviews.Title: “staff unfriendly!”
Reviews.Author: ElleLondon
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and first impression not good as staff very unfriendly!! only one who smiled was the doorman! we were given a room in the old wing. Clean but very small and would only recommend the rooms overlooking the pool area. good location for public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Beverly Hills Hotel - a beautiful apartment for the price of a room!”
Reviews.Author: Cleopatra561
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for almost 15 years, several times a year. It is beautifully located on Wilshire and Comstock, just a very short drive into Beverly Hills for dinner, or to Brentwood to visit friends. We always stay in a deluxe one bedroom suite or 2 bedroom 2 bath suite, and by suite, I can attest that these are really apartments, with huge living rooms, dining room, full kitchen, huge bedroom, walk in closets, beautiful marble bathrooms with jacuzzi tubs. I would never stay anywhere else in Beverly Hills. It is best to rent a car at the airport so you will have the means to pop into your favorite restaurant such as Spago, or drive out to the beach, and the Getty, all within a short drive of the Beverly Hills Plaza. LOVE IT AND LOVE THE ENTIRE STAFF!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: we_drive
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, convenient location to Hollywood, downtown LA, Rodeo shopping, the beaches, and Beverly Hills. Internet and parking are extra, $20 for wifi and $28 for parking, both are per night. Nice, clean room. The swimming pool and hot tub was really nice, they also had cool chairs to lounge on by the pool. All rooms come with either a full kitchen or kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “A thoroughly enjoyable experience at reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: nddesai
Reviews.Content: Hotel is extremely comfortable, pleasant, Hasianda structure in classical Spanish architecture. It has private fish ponds, excellent greenery, well furnished and provided rooms with excellent kitchen attached. Hotel is well connected by public transport which is rare in Los Angeles. Very helpful and friendly staff. Extremely quiet and peaceful atmosphere. I will definitely prefer to stay here. Restaurant facilities was the only weakness.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLover72
Reviews.Content: This is a quirky little hotel and happened to have one of the last rooms available in LA this week so I ended up here. They certainly exceeded my expectations. They upgraded me to a kitchenette suite just for the asking, room was clean and nice, they give you the LA Times instead of that cheesy USA Today, the pool & front lobby are spectacular, but best of all was the service. my room was in an odd little annex with a charming waterfall and koi pond, and was only to be reached by a mysterious series of passages & footbridges My first time thru I got lost & the front desk clerk literally RAN to my rescue & guided me thru the jungle. When I asked about pool hours I was told it closed at 10:00pm but if I wanted to swim later- no problem, they would work it out. The restaurant was small and needs updating but they were also quite gracious here. When I asked to be seated on the banquette even though several clean tables were available they quickly cleaned it off, when I asked to order off the lunch menu even though it was dinner,no problem (yes this was a test!) none of the sulksand eye-rolling you often get even at the nicest hotels. At the Plaza the customer is truly king.

Reviews.Title: “Not close to anything, Will be charged for Minibar even if you dont use!”
Reviews.Author: arjungupta101
Reviews.Content: 1. It is not a convenient location if you dont have a car. No restaurant/grocer/market/shopping-mall closeby. Cabs are v.expensive in LA. A bus stops right in front, but frequency is 30 minutes. Better stay in a more happening location where there are things around. 2. Reception staff is rude 3. They charged me $13.8 for items that I did not use in the Minibar. I confirmed upon checkout that I did not use anything from minibar. After 2 days they booked a charge on my credit card for it. THIEVES!!! 4. Rooms are large, spacious, but a little foul odour. 5. Too many stairs through a maze to reach the rooms. 6. Expensive Internet - $15per day. Cmon an expensive boutique hotel should not be petty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: roughout
Reviews.Content: Had a friend visiting from UK and he booked 3 nights here. The room was a suite with a sitting room and a bedroom. Bathroom was a little cramped but adequate water pressure and clean. The housekeeping staff was very efficient and fast. Turn on the privacy light is you sleep in late. There is an issue with sound between rooms. We were laying around on Sunday morning and heard someone say "woof" and we were sure they were in the room. It was in the next room and they were close to the door that can be used to connect the rooms. No big deal. For what was being paid and what you get this is a GREAT value in a great location with great amenities. If I need to stay in LA again this will be one of my first choices.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: amow84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May while visiting friends in California. While it could have been improved in some areas, it was worthwhile and the staff were rather friendly. We're planning on visiting again this December and will be staying there again. Definitely recommend this place for families!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value,stuck up staff!”
Reviews.Author: luckyamerica36
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of a 2 week trip around southern California.Hotel itself is lovely.We had a junior suite which was clean and comfortable.Bathroom a bit on the small side but clean which to me is much more important.We had no problem sleeping as it was so quiet.I did feel most of the staff were pretty stuck up.This may be due to the name/location of the hotel but my money is just as good as anyone else's and i did feel they looked down their noses at us in our shorts and flip flops!Having said that one of the young girls was very helpful when we asked for directions to The Grove.We took the advice from other reviews and parked opposite the hotel,i do think $28 per day to park at the hotel is a bit over the top.The location is perfect for sightseeing as you are central between Santa Monica beach and Hollywood.I would stay here again without a doubt as it is such good value for money and so clean.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Tripaholic1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a suite in this hotel in August. At first galnce, walking into the lobby, it seemed like a luxurious upscal hotel with roses and everything. Boy, was I was wrong. That night, when we were already in bed, we get a phone call after 11:00 PM, as well as a knock on the door, from room service who apparently had thh wrong room. We also kept hearing people talking outside and doors slamming well into the night. To make matters worse, the guests in the room next to us checked in late and were talking until 4:00 AM. The walls are so thin so it sounded as though they were in our room. I could not sleep until they finally went to bed after 4:00 AM. As I checked out. I told the receptionist behind the front desk of my experience and all she could say was "Sorry" and did not seem surprised as to imply that she knows that the walls and these complaints are common.

Reviews.Title: “Updated review from a frequent visitor”
Reviews.Author: DCroamer
Reviews.Content: Because it is close to where my in-laws live, my wife and I have become regulars at the Beverly Park Plaza. Last year alone, we stayed for multiple days on at least four occasions. Once, due to a death in the family, we recently stayed here for over two weeks. As noted by other reviewers, this can be a quirky hotel and the service can be inconsistent. However the price is usually right and there are many good things about staying here. Many complaints seem to originate from visitors who have stayed in the annex. We have not stayed in the annex and know enough to ask for a suite in the back and not on Wilshire Blvd. What we like. We like the suite and the price. I canâ€™t think of anywhere else in the area where you get basically a full one bedroom apartment for that price. Yes, the decore is a bit on the dated side, but it is generally in good shape. We like the full kitchen facilities. We go to the store before checking in and buy all of our breakfast needs and usually only go to room service for extra coffee. But weâ€™ve also used room service. Room service is ok, not spectacular, but it is sufficient for most snake or â€œtoo tiredâ€� to go out conditions. You wonâ€™t write home about the food, but it isnâ€™t bad either. We like the cleaning staff. Our rooms have always been very clean and well tended to. We like the valets. They get to know you, they work hard. We like the location, walk-able to either Beverly Hills or Westwood. For us, we really donâ€™t have to drive much in LA, which given that it is LA, that is remarkable. The air conditioning isnâ€™t bad. Can get the room reasonably cold, which is important. The pool area is inviting. Weâ€™ve enjoyed lunch around the pool on a couple of occasions. We used to think the gym was ok. They recently moved it as part of the remodel. While the equipment is ok, theyâ€™ve made it harder to watch tv while on the treadmill than it used to be. Its not bad, just not great. Some things we havenâ€™t like. While there are some lovely people at the front desk, there are a couple that have quite an attitude. I think they think this hotel is in Beverly Hills catering to the stars instead of being Beverly Hills adjacent catering to people waiting for their plastic surgery to heal, in town for their nephewâ€™s Bar Mitzvah or visiting in-laws. A small matter, but they should get over themselves. Another complaint. I feel I am a regular. As said, Iâ€™ve stayed at this hotel now more than 10 times. When I was there for a funeral â€“ a booked stay of more than two weeks â€“ I was given a note around day 10 asking me to come down and settle my bill. Seriously, they knew we were in town for a funeral. They knew that weâ€™d stayed there multiple times. Indeed, we were scheduled to stay there again in just over a month at Christmas. I know it was about accounting, but it felt like they didnâ€™t trust me. Frankly I was insulted. Having said that, not insulted enough to not stay here because the rates and the other advantages are too good. The internet is terrible here. They charge for it ($15 a day â€“ and what is that? You canâ€™t give free internet access?) and when you do pay for it, it can be sporadic. There is a business center where you can access the internet for free, but they make it a hassle to get a hotel password and the staff doesnâ€™t understand the equipment very well. Some of the rooms have the special foam beds. I donâ€™t like the foam beds. They make me hot. If you would rather have a regular mattress, you should ask for one. Theyâ€™ve always been quite accommodating to us on this front. Anyway, this is a solid, basic hotel. It isnâ€™t glamorous (in spite of what some at the desk might want to believe) but it is very good value for money for the most part, convenient, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect apartment for a family.”
Reviews.Author: Emma B
Reviews.Content: We were travelling in Southern California with children aged 6 and 9 and we had a suite with two double beds in the bedroom. The great thing about these suites is that its like a home away from home. The kitchenette could be better equipped but has your basics to cook breakfast or a meal if you wanted to. There are 2 tv's so the adults and kids could both relax without being on top of each other. The staff were very helpful. Pool area great. Parking was a bit overpriced but we didnt have a problem parking directly opposite the hotel on the side of the road. This hotel was also located in the perfect spot for enjoying a holiday in Los Angeles. We even indulged in a few restaurants in Beverly Hills which were not as expensive as you might think - we jumped online and checked prices before we booked. The hotel has wireless internet available at a cost per day also. There are inhouse laundry facilities but only one machine for the whole hotel but we found most guests were sending things off for drycleaning anyway so the machines were always free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location. Road noise and cell signal, not so good.”
Reviews.Author: Mavtech
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they upgraded us to one bedroom suites. We thought, "Sweet!" It was nice when we walked into the rooms. But, when it came time to sleep, it wasn't so nice. The bed was rock hard. The rooms in the front of the main building are right over Wilshire Blvd. There is no white noise in the room to drown out the traffic. It's very loud! So, I had to sleep on the couch my first night. I changed rooms to the back of the hotel the next night. Other than no elevator access to these rooms and the non-existent cell signal, it was so much better. So, if you have an iPhone, expect no or little signal in this hotel. There is a very serene waterfall and stream going through the middle of this building. I really like this touch. The location is very nice and not far at all from restaurants and other things to do. The parking is expensive at $28 per day plus tips for the valet. If you don't want to valet, you have to park across Wilshire Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: EugeC
Reviews.Content: This hotel on Wilshire features a recently remodeled spectacular lobby and very large rooms at good value -- I had a suite complete with basic cooking facilities. However, many rooms are not located in convenient locales relative to the elevators. To get to my room, I had to lug my baggage up several small sets of steps, navigate some confusing passageways, cross some wet floors, etc. The hotel may be good for vacation getaways because of its quirky nature, but is too awkward to navigate for business travelers and those not comfortable with navigating many steps.

Reviews.Title: “Not what i expected for the location”
Reviews.Author: emily092
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, my time share is alot more plush and fancy compared to this suite. We had the executive suite Queen bed with living room, marble bath. the bath was the nicest part of the whole room. There is only one bed, with two persons in the room. i would have though the couch in the living room was a sofa bed. nope. the couch is where the other person slept. The couch is maybe around 5 feet long. Yes you need to park on Wilshire a very busy street, valet is 28.00 a night, we were here for business and got there around 7:00pm and left again to see the town. when we got back it was 11:30 so paying for valet was silly. I asked if we could park in front where others were parked and the valet person said i park your car. I would think for free so i could go check in,no it was 8:00 an hour. forget it. Then i asked if there was handicap parking, which i have a placard, and he laughed and said no on the street to.. is this not a law that there should be handicap access for all hotels? I expected more being in Beverly hills and was very disappointed. In the lobby, there was a quest before me and she just looked me up and down like what are you doing here. I had an overnight bag i carried in myself,oh my that must have been it, and my computer, we had just spent the day at UCLA at the book festival and we were exhibitors. When i called for the directions to the hotel i was told my reservation wasn't until Sunday. i had all the print out and told them they were wrong. they said we will see when i got there... i except this from a lower priced hotel not this three or four class place.. Then when the room charge was added to my card there was a charge of 101.00 more than the room. I called and was told they take around 80.00 extra in case you use any of the amenaties.. i asked him where that was written, he just said that is what they do. at most of the hotels i have stayed at that is on the site or are told this in advance at the desk. not a word..I would never stay there again even if it was free. i would stay at Motel 6. The price was ok but come on now i could have stayed at courtyard for this amount and it would have been nicer.. go else where to stay if you need to stay in LA or around there...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice large and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 2manydaystillfri
Reviews.Content: Traveled with sister and my teenagers. Suite was very large and roomy, loved the kitchen. Was easy to get in and out of. Central to all we were going to. Parked across the street easily and avoided the internet charge buy bringing my wireless card for internet.(Don't leave home without it!) Loved the pool, absolutely beautiful. Did not use the restaurant but looked expensive and dark. No worries there are plenty of other places around the block on Santa Monica. Loved it and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Try Somewhere Else”
Reviews.Author: Drewem
Reviews.Content: Located on a busy road during the day although could not hear any traffic from our room. Hotel parking $28US per day, car parks across the road just a short walk. Hotel reception looks great and also pool area and gym look good. Rooms left a lot to be desired, as other reviewers have stated, thin walls and ceiling (could hear person above our room walking around, gee they did a lot of walking too), rooms are large but outdated. Our room had a musky old smell about it, smelt look it hadn't been opened and aired for awhile plus a lack of light. Back window off kitchenette had a view of an industrial sized airconditioner and a slight hum. Small bathroom. Internet $20US per day did not use. Did not think much of the menu and prices so did not eat there. Staff at reception were not that helpful, don't expect them to go above the call of duty.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Value”
Reviews.Author: Galila
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this hotel in west LA. Read mixed reviews and glad I took a chance, because it was excellent all round. Service from staff was superior and all the rooms are in fact suites so even the basic accommodation has style, equipment and comfort. I particularly enjoyed the pool area and private jacuzzi - just what business travelers need at the end of the working day.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: NHguy_9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed in this hotel for 10 days, ending on December 30, 2009. Anyone seeking to stay in this hotel should read this review. By way of background, we are both professionals (lawyers), live in New Hampshire, in our early 50s. I would consider staying in this hotel again, but with a few adustments. I don't often (ever?) write reviews such as this, But I wish I had one that was complete before I had booked. Overall, it is a nice hotel. It is essentially a 2-section hotel. There is the normal "main" hotel and rooms, including the front desk, courtyard with nice looking pool (I didn't go in it) surrounded by rooms with balconies overlooking the pool. It looked very nice, but I didn't go into any of these rooms. There is also the "other" section, which looks like an apartment complex next door that was purchased by the hotel and renovated into hotel rooms. My wife and I stayed in this section, which is accessed from the front desk by a few ways, but the most common seems to be by going up one floor on the elevator (which is small, but adequate), and then walking through a somewhat weird, short maze of walkways leading to the courtyard for this "other" section. We stayed in room 632, which was fine/nice. However, if I had any sort of walking issue, it would have been torture, as the room (and most rooms in this "other" section) require going up a series of short staircases. The courtyard is very California, and contains a fake, but arguably pleasant, waterfall/stream thing and some nice bushes, along with a hot tub located awkwardly directly outside some poor soul's room. The grounds are maintained very well. It seemed every time we walked out of the room, there was some sweeping or other cleaning activity occuring. Housekeeping was excellent. I tipped $5/day, and $20 on Christmas eve. Good for me. I agree with other reviewers that there are people living in this hotel full time. That was confirmed by sources I will not name. Somewhat weird, but it didn't impact our stay in any way. If it wasn't for the following items, I would consider returning to this hotel: 1. Internet access. This hotel charges $15/day for this service. I complained, but was told it was provided by an outside service, and that they couldn't do anything about it. Very lame. In addition, the internet service was lousy, and would not allow me to send e-mails, although I could recieve them. I had to set up a Gmail account to communicate with clients and the office to take care of a few things. The hotel's website states the " ... internet connection provided by Apex Net Systems," but fails to state that there is a $15/day fee. I find the website to be misleading in this regard. Take a look for yourself, and see what you think: http://beverlyhillsplazahotel.com/hotelamenities.htm. Bottom line: If you rely on internet access like I do, add $15 to the hotel's daily rate when doing your comparisons with other hotels. Even then, it's not very good service. Also, the hotel's business/conference room is modest at best, and requires the same password/username as required in your room for internet access. Ugh! 2. Mini Bar. Total rip off. Best advice - have the hotel empty it before your arrival. When we arrived in our room, we had a nice basket of wine and cheeses (from our in-laws) and a couple beers, bottles of water, and a juice or two in the fridge (also, we thought, from our in-laws or leftovers from the prior hotel-goers). As we arrived at 2:00 a.m., I cracked open a water from the fridge, and sucked down a scotch from the basket. Life is good. But apparently, all of the stuff in the fridge is part of the "mini-bar," and the hotel charges dearly for this stuff. I still don't know what exactly I took from the fridge, but it wasn't much, and the total mini-bat bill added up to around $40, more or less. I complained to the front desk, was promised a call from the manager (which never arrived), and I paid it with gritted teeth so as not to tarnish my vacation experience, with the knowledge I would be writing this review. But I will continue to complain (I guess I am right now!), and will update this site if the hotel manager ever comes through and does the right thing. If I were the manager, I would have called, apologized, and sent flowers, or whatever. But I guess the manager was too busy to address a legitimate concern of one of its clients that paid the hotel for 10 days of its hotel's services. Shameful, in my humble opinion, on a whole host of levels. What is really deceitful is that there is a locked cabinet with a glass front with a bunch of small bottles of liquor, wine, chips in it. We believed, rightfully so, that this locked cabinet was the mini bar. So beware. 3. TV service. Channels 2 through 9 or so look good, including HBO on channel 3. Above that, they are all "snowy." All analog. Disappointing at best, especially when they spent a few dollars for decent flat screen TVs in the living room and bedroom, and then don't deliver with comparable service. 4. Parking. Valet service is $28/day. No way. Park across the street, on the street. I did this for all but the first day. No problems. 5. Noise. Walls are thin. TV on in the next room is audible. Bring ear plugs or Ambien. So, I won't recommend this hotel, because I don't feel it was honest with the charges. I don't mind paying for things I agree to pay for, but I resent being charged for things (or forced to pay for things) I didn't agree to up front. With a few adjustments as I have described, I would recommend this hotel, but I just can't. Look around for other choices. I will.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value for money”
Reviews.Author: katie640
Reviews.Content: loved it Clean, great location , perect for sightseeing around LA dont waste your money in 5 star -this has everything u could need staff amazing and best of all we ran into the playboy bunnies!!!! 20mins to santa monica, 10 mins to rodeo drive

Reviews.Title: “CLEAN ...I like clean!”
Reviews.Author: mylady68
Reviews.Content: They missed up on my daughter's food order but over all it was about being there

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: tourist083
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus another couple stayed at the hotel for 6 nights. What a wonderful experience. The staff were a delight. The valet, reception and maid service was all that you could ask for. The restaurant was excellent with terrific food and real value for money. The restaurant staff were without exception wondeful, especially Saul who ensured that all customers were looked after. The rooms were clean and spacious with a well equipped kitchen and bathroom. The grounds were well looked after with a well appointed spa. The pool area was awesome where you could relax. The reception staff had lots of great ideas for tours and sight seeing and ensured that our stay was a worry free one. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: odanilina
Reviews.Content: This is the best 3* hotel I've been to. Was expecting something much worse as all last hotel experiences were in 5* hotels. Rooms are big, clean and comfortable, bathrooms have all necessary things that you might need. Our room also had a kitchen which we didn't use though. Jacuzzi (outside the room) that you can use in the night was very nice and relaxing thing to have. Can't judge the restaurant as we never visited it. Having a car its one of the best not expensive places to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - reception staff a little stuck up”
Reviews.Author: PeterLk
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel in a very good location in LA. Not far from the likes of Rodeo Drive and a short drive to Hollywood and not far from the coast. The rooms are a delight with mini bar internet access and plasma tv. Lovely pool and area to relax in the middle of the hotel. All was really good apart from the check in staff who were unhelpful unpolite and just really could not give a toss about a young couple that havent money to throw about. We paid around 400 dollars for the 3 nights which to some may not seem like much but to us was about our limit. The guy who took the car at the front door was great. Really nice and very helpful. He did get a tip. Put him in behind the desk and throw the two dumb receptions out to park the cars.

Reviews.Title: “Souless hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianabecker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in May and the hotel leave's a lot to be desired. Although the rooms are quiet large, but the rooms are dated and dark. The hotel is souless, dated and depressing. Its located outside of Beverly Hills on the on Wilshire Corridor, with nothing around but apartment blocks and the traffic of Wilshire Blvd. As other reviewer have also stated the walls in the rooms are very thin and i was woken up, to a very noisy couple next door having sex loudly for over an hour, im guessing the beds in the rooms were back to back. The staff, are not very friendly and seem almost bored whilst working. I your looking for somewhere to crash for a few days in a central location whilst in L.A, then the hotel is borderline just OK, but if your doing a longer stay or a vacation in L.A, then i would definitely give this hotel a miss by all counts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Francais50
Reviews.Content: Just came back from five days in LA staying at the Beverly Hills Plaza Hotel. The hotel is well kept, clean, nicely appointed and the staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms were cleaned daily and early. There were always enough towels, soaps and other amenities. The location of the hotel was very central for our needs. We were only a short drive to 405, Santa Monica Blvd., LaCienega Blvd and Sunset. Valet parking is available at $20 per night, but there is loads of street parking available as well. If I had any negative comments to make, it would be that the drawers stuck in the dresser-no big deal. I absolutely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother!”
Reviews.Author: sandyagan
Reviews.Content: A disappointment to say the least. Our room, #633, an "executive suite" was next to a room that at first we suspected was occupied by a permanent resident because of the unsightly accumulation of very large water containers outside the door which was ajar revealing a cluttered mess and several live plants. Live plants in a hotel room? Something didn't seem right. After being disturbed at 3 a.m. with the rattling of dishes, which went on for an hour, we asked the front desk what was going on in the next room and were told that it was being used as a plastic surgeon's overnight recovery room! This hotel has thin walls, very poor TV reception and you need a map to find the rooms with these directions - "take the elevator to the 2nd floor, then take 3 right turns" but they didn't mention that there were multiple stairways - a virtual labyrinth. Try that while handling your bags. And then we found ourselves next door to a recovery room! This not exactly what we had in mind when we booked a hotel in Beverly Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest, crummy”
Reviews.Author: billypete
Reviews.Content: The room was compact but functional. Suite style. Tiny bedroom, efficient lounge are with kitchenette. The rooms open to a terraced series of steps with an artifical stream. Painfully humid. I was afraid of slipping and breaking my neck every step. Someone seemed to be living permanently in the adjacent room. There is valet, but pulling out onto Wilshire is harrowing since you are situated in the middle of a hill just after a curve. After I checked out they charged me for something from the minibar I didn't take. When I disputed the charge, they sent a forged reciept to my credit card company. I hate dishonest hoteliers.

Reviews.Title: “UpDate -- revisiting this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DCroamer
Reviews.Content: Based on my previous experience, I returned for a nine day stay over the Christmas 2007 holiday. Again, found the hotel clean, staff helpful, room service good, accomodations pleasant and location good for Beverly Hills & Westwood & Century City. THe update is this: first, they are building some big apartment building across the street. The pile drivers and saws started early...at least up until the day before Christmas. Be aware that this construction looks to be going on for some time to come...though the noise from it will likely deminish as time goes on. However, we found it difficult to stay asleep much beyond 7:30 am on the days they were working (especially true if you open the windows to let in fresh air). Second, hotel re-habbing is ongoing. THe main lobby area has been closed off. One of the elevators wasn't working. Clearly some rooms were in the process of being re-done. They said they were looking at a copule of months work...then they would be raising their rates to about $375 per room per night (above the very reasonable for location and siize I paid). Still the accomodations were a better bargain than some other suite hotels in the area...but the potential price increase will move it out of the good deal catagory. Third, when we were there in October, our room had a regular matress that was one of the more comfortable hotel beds my wife and I ever slpet in. This time, we had one of those temperpedic (sp?) matresses...i.e. foam that seems to mold around your body. Far less happy with that...though I am sure some like it. It felt like we were sleeping on sand and also made the bed hot, IMO. Much perferred the old-style matress, this would cause us to reconsider staying there again as we never felt we got a great night sleep. Fourth, the water pressure in our room was problematic. There were problems, when we mentioned it to the desk they seemed to hop to and get it fixed, but it seems like more problems with water pressure were looming, given the hotel re-habbing. Overall, we continue to like this hotel. Having a full kitchen available as well as living room and eat-in dinning room for the price we paid in Beverly Hills/Westwood was terrific. We gave it a higher rating the first time we stayed. It is still a good hotel, but price and conditions may reduce its desirability, affordability and many of its good points.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Spez
Reviews.Content: I stayed for four nights while doing business in the area. I booked a non-smoking room. My room wasn't ready when I arrived. When the room was ready, the room was a smoking room. There were no non-smoking rooms available until the next night, so I stayed the first night in the smoking room, which smelled like an ash tray. That night a noisy party started up at about 2:00 a.m. I called the front desk, and after about an hour a security guard shut down the party. The next three nights I stayed in a non-smoking room. The carpet was filthy and stained, so much so that I didn't go barefoot in the room! On the positive side, the front desk staff, and the restaurant/bar staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “nice beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: redivan666
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night at this hotel with my girlfriend during our road trip across the west coast. We decided to stay there due to the large distances between places in LA, so after spendind 2 days in Sta Monica we took the chance of staying in this upper class hotel. Amazingly it wasnÂ´t much more expensive than our last location so the price was nice. We get there very early in the morning just hoping to leave our luggage there and coming back later on. When we get to the entrance the guy of the valet parking took our luggage in and asked for the room to the front desk staff. He told us to go and surprisingly the room was ready so we did the check in and get to the room. It was a nice room, a little bit dark because the best rooms facing the pool are the suites ones but really big and well decorated. We had a jr suite wich had a full kitchen inside, with oven, microwave, fridge and anything you may need to cook and have lunch or dinner. The bed was really big and comfy, we had a nice sofa and a huge TV. The bathroom was really good, made of marble and with thow bathrobes and slippers. Everything was spotless and when we get to the room at night we had the bed open for us and the light switched on. The service was great and the maid service too. The only bad thing is that there was no breakfast included (but thatÂ´s for sure the same in this class of hotels). Also they offered us valet parking for 15 $ per night which we declined because there was a lot of free parking outside on the street. Apart from that, the check out was correct and also the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: zizidims
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Beverly Hills Plaza Hotel at the 20th of July. The room was big with a small kitchenette. The pool is nice as well as the little restaurant. Good location, rodeo drive around the corner... I can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was sufficient”
Reviews.Author: Tickie
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, unique rooms. Our room had a small kitchenette which was handy. Wasn't sure about the bed linen and the small couch. Felt a bit itchy, and wasn't confident that everything was clean. Felt a bit insecure with the security, as didn't feel the locks were safe and can understand why in previous reviews, there has been concerns of people going into their room whilst they were out. Though attractive little hotel, dont think I would recommend to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Plastic Surgery Recovery Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerOC
Reviews.Content: My reservation was handled through La Bella, a cosmetic surgery aftercare service. I stressed to Connie who runs La Bella, that I wanted privacy, quiet and the amenities of a 4 star hotel within 5 minutes from Beverly Hills where my doctor's office is located. I didn't want to get car sick after my surgery. My experience with Connie and my stay here was fabulous. Connie picked me up at my doctor's office in her limo and ushered me into the hotel through the private back entrance. Before I knew it I was comfortably tucked in my bed. My room was a one bedroom suite located towards the rear of hotel. The room was extremely comfortable with a small kitchen where Connie prepared homemade meals for me. There was a nice living room/ dining area that would have been perfect had I had guests. My bedroom was quiet and dimly lit exactly as I requested. The bed was comfortable and bedding was high thread count. The pillows and comforter were down. If you're considering having cosmetic surgery and you're looking for a spacious hotel suite in this area in which to recover, you will not beat this price or the quality of care Connie of La Bella offers her clients. Considering this is not a 5 star hotel, my experience was 5 stars and I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: marissa2c
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for at this hotel. I paid $137/nt average for 2 nights booking thru the hotel website. I got an Executive Queen room which is essentially a small 1 br apt. The bedroom was average size. The bathroom was really small, but that's typical of most older LA (and NYC) properties. The living room was average size and the kitchenette was really a "nette". A 2 burner stove with an under counter refrigerator. The walls are very thin and you can hear your next door neighbor very clearly. They also allow dogs and the room next door did have one. If you book a room other than a luxury 1br you will have to walk anywhere from 1 flight of stairs to 4 flights of stairs. My guest who uses a cane and I ended up walking up 3 flights of stairs to get to the room. I asked for a room change and was told that I could pay for a luxury room at a rate of $250/nt and that they were sold out for the other room categories. For that money I would have stayed at the Luxe on Sunset or LeMontrose. Some positives include: the room is close to UCLA area and valet parking is only $15/day which is a bargain for LA hotels. You also get a robe in the bathroom. The people were nicer than average and try to be helpful albeit in that aloof kinda manner. Room service food was good tasting- some items were priced well and some were overpriced. If you are willing to put up with the negatives of the hotel, then this hotel is definitely a good value play.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: Carlton's Mom
Reviews.Content: I needed a room for about 6 hours during a layover between flights. The room was dark, dingy, and had a VERY strong odor of tobacco smoke. The room was saturated with smoke odor and leaving the front door propped open for 2 hours was no remedy. Upon check out, the reply of the desk clerk was simply, "Here is your receipt". $125 for a 5 hour stay in a stinky, dingy room. PATHETIC. Avoid this hotel. It is old and smelly and there is NO customer service. Also, it appears someone had entered my room and used my bathroom while I was out having dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great bargain”
Reviews.Author: Desmeraldo
Reviews.Content: We got an internet rate of $109. The room had a separate living room, with couch and kitchenette, nicely furnished, clean, separate bedroom, very nice bed, robes and slippers, nice friendly staff, I could not believe we got this room for $109, this is a STEAL!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Sassa1162
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here to visit all the tourist spots in Hollywood! The location was perfect.. close to the beach (approx. 20 min. drive) and close to the hot spots such as Sunset Strip and Hollywood Blvd (approx. 10 mins or less).. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and our room was very nice and clean. The pool and hot tub was very nice and the grounds around the hotel were very pretty. The only issue we had was that the elevators were being fixed the week of our stay, so we had to walk a few flights of stairs (approx. 15 steps) to get up to our room (not a big deal).. but thought I should mention for handicap persons. The walls in the suite part of the room were a bit thin, we could here the person in the next room, but in the bedroom we could not hear anything or anyone. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel. Considering the prices of the other hotels in the area, this one was priced the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for an awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: bigmama4k
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in the queen suite for three nights and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were spotless, the linens were down rather than chintzy velum, the kitchenette area in the sitting area made the stay feel like home. The bathroom is a bit tight, but it is clean and well equipped. There is marble throughout, along with nightly turn down service, and the grounds are very scenic. The staff couldnt be more helpful, whether at the front desk, in the restaurant, or when arranging a cab for us. We were on the second floor and it was a bit of a walk up and down several levels to get to our room, but well worth it. The hotel is about a $36 cab ride from LAX and a short drive (or long walk) to Beverly Hills shopping. We were there because we had tickets to American Idol, and the staff shared in our enthusiasm. The next time I am in Beverly Hills, I will book with this hotel and look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I stayed at this hotel and I would return. I initially booked a room at another hotel in Beverly Hills but found the rooms too tiny for the cost and moved to this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised. Our new room was very spacious, the bedroom, bathroom and kitchen had been renovated. There was a jacuzzi tub and the cost was less than the other hotel. I thought the living room furniture was a bit dated, but nice and the service was impeccable. We have relatives in Los Angeles, we visit frequently and we plan to stay at the Beverly Hills Plaza Hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the rate, but a little strange”
Reviews.Author: krebloggs
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, especially for the rate. It was 119$ I believe for a suite with a huge bathroom, living room, kitchenette that included a small stove, and a bedroom with a queen bed. my only caveat is that the area that is not around the pool is hard to navigate and only available by stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Untrustworty - don't know the meaning of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for about 10 years during my frequent trips to LA and have always loved my stay there. However, this last stay was the worst hotel experience I've ever had. After having to switch rooms twice in order to get a "non-smoking" room that didn't smell of cigarette smoke (it triggers asthma), someone, most likely a staff member, entered my room while I was out, smoked cigarettes and consumed $15 from the mini bar. The manager on staff was completely unapologietic and refused to do anything about it. I was assured the general manager, who conveniently came back on duty the day after I checked out, would contact me immediately and inform me on what steps had been taken. I never recieved such a call and my subsequent follow up calls were not answered. It seems to me like this was not the first instance, the hotel staff knew about these unauthorized entrances and were all covering for each other. I have never felt so uncomfortable in a hospitality situation in my life. Very disturbing.

Reviews.Title: “My Stay @ Beverly Hills Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jktdesigns
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 9/28/05-10/2/05. Rooms were small, but decent. Travelzoo advertised 1/2 price rooms-was on sale for 99.00 w/upgrade if available. Of course, wasn't available. Kind of a long walk from lobby to rooms on west wing of hotel. Dirty elevator takes you to 2nd floor--then the walking starts (round the corner, around back of of elevator, between bldgs,go upstairs, go downstairs)--this part gets old quick. Bldg was formerly an appartment bldg. 1st bed lumpy, room small--asked to be moved. Was moved, bed was same size, furniture has an "old" look, but apparently is the hotel's decor. Initial thoughts were not to stay there again. But was not too too bad; may stay there again. Valet is $15 and most of the time, car is park at front door(s). Many times I simply retrieved the keys from the attendant and pulled off from where the car was parked. Good location-not far from Rodeo, Beaches, Sunset, Santa Monica, etc., however,driveway entrance is very busy and do to the speed of LA drivers, be careful when turning in (off Wilshire Blvd)-almost like an accident waiting to happen (saw one at entrance). Overall, hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service and attention”
Reviews.Author: OleMiss4Ever
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay here for the night of September 29. All I can say is that it was one of the nicest rooms we have seen and they gave us excellent amenities. For dinner, we ate at Mastros, which was fine. But, we went there via a new stretch limousine that the hotel offers its guests. It is first come, first served and goes up to a 3 mile radius. This makes sense due to the demand. The staff was very pleasant and asked if they could do anything. The Polo Lounge food was good, but the famous French Toast is a MUST HAVE!!!! Best breakfast I ever had. As a matter of fact, I had these 15 years ago and told my wife I look forward to having them again. We slept in the hotel, not the bungalows. This was for convenience. We loved the pool. Dane, one of the pool attendants, was very helpful. We did feel like royalty. For an experience, this is it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a very pretty hotel on a very busy part of Wilshire Boulevard, close to the Beverly Hills Country Club, near Century City, but outside the actual Beverly Hills limits sign. It was the epitome of what we imagined Beverly Hills to be. From the outside the white wrought iron balconies and climbing plants gave it an old style charm; the gilt, brass and mirrors in the entrance, lifts and reception provide Hollywood glitz and the fairy lights in the trees around the pool in the restaurant are magical, rather than tacky. We only stayed here one night, but we loved this hotel. The accommodation (a basic room with King sized bed) had a bar area with sink, fridge, mini-bar. Strangely there were a couple of bottles in the fridge that we had access to, however we had no means of accessing the mini-bar. The bed was very comfortable, the furnishings and dÃ©cor was simple but chic and the bathroom, although small was very well presented. We were very surprised about some of the other reviews, as we found the staff to be very courteous and helpful, parking fees were advertised and drinks and food may not have been cheap, but you donâ€™t expect them to be in a smart hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: rahir
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the BH Plaza was adequate at best. The location was great for us, as we were attending a wedding around the corner, and our room was spacious (an end suite way back by the waterfall). The lobby staff, though, was unhelpful and at times downright rude, and the last day, I noticed that some of my jewelry had gone missing. I asked when we checked out, and the concierge said that the only person that had gone into our room was housecleaning. She said I had to ask them, but no housekeeping staff could be found. I called back 3 times that week and each time was given the brush-off. No help searching for the jewelry or inquiring about it. For the price of our stay, we should have gotten better service.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: judahvista
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here in January. We were lucky enough to get a double upgrade from American Express which really made the stay memorable. The room was large and impeccable. The staff was great for the most part, especially Nancy. She remembered who I was and called me by name every day. The waiters were also wonderful and were attentive, as was housekeeping. The only real problem was I was too busy sightseeing to really enjoy the room. I love traveling to different hotels, but I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: LesAndLes
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is lovely - good sized rooms (with kitchens), bathrooms a little small but fully stocked with amenities, pleasant and helpful staff. It's constructed around two courtyards and there are a fair number of small stairways involved in reaching many of the rooms, particularly in the west wing, but guests are repaid by a scenic pool, whirlpool and even waterfall. Two drawbacks, neither of which can easily be fixed: the hotel is pretty remote - about a mile walk back to Westwood or east to Beverly Hills, although Wilshire Blvd. has a decent bus service; also, the walls are paper thin, which can be a problem as all conversations in the next room are distinctly audible.
